column4: Is there a program similar to GPartEd that would allow me to copy a partition? Example:  I am buying a new hard drive, and have no intention of keeping this one, as it is old and less than 100GB.  Is there a way I can just copy this hard drive info to the new hard drive WITHOUT having to do a full install of Ubuntu and lose everything?
So I could theoretically just copy the /home/ fold in it's entirety and drop it on the new hard drive, and all should work?
other than like cp -a /eachsource /eachdest  you will also need to install an mbr on the new disk and maybe do some changes of /etc/fstab of the new hdid or /dev/sdX
